events.name: iOS Dev Scout May 2017 Meetup
events.description: Venue: Carousell. 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #12-00 Keppel Tower 2 Singapore[masked] Speakers: ‚Ä¢ Jacky Chua -¬†Senior iOS Engineer at PIXERF ‚Ä¢¬†Subhransu Behera - Lead iOS Developer at Singapore Power Agenda: ‚Ä¢ 6:30pm: Come have some pizza (Sponsored by Carousell), say hello to other iOS devs¬† ‚Ä¢ 7:15pm:¬†Create app/game a la Nintendo Switch via peer-to-peer networking - by Jacky ‚Ä¢ 7:45pm:¬†iOS Delivery Pipeline at Singapore Power - by Subh ‚Ä¢¬†8:15pm: Show & Tell, quiz with collectibles to be won! About the Topics: ‚Ä¢¬†Jacky will share his experiences on ‚ÄòCreating app/game a la Nintendo Switch via peer-to-peer networking‚Äô, utilising MultiplieerConnectivity framework to connect multiple devices and transferring data between devices to create similar experience as Nintendo Switch. ‚Ä¢¬†Subh will share how the iOS engineers at Singapore Power deliver their builds to the POs and beta testers. He will showcase the tools they use and discuss about the branching strategy, build versions and delivery process they follow at SP.  iOS Conf SG 2017 iOS Conf SG 2017¬†will be happening in October and more information on the conference will be released during out meetups, and in our Facebook pages.¬† We have opened our slack group to everyone this year to provide a platform for all to meet up with like-minded developers, collaborate with one another and become friends for life. Register here to join the iOS Conf SG Slackgroup: https://slackpass.io/iosconfsg  About iOS Conf SG 2016 iOS Conf SG is an annual iOS conference organised by us. Last year's conference was on the 20th and 21st of October @ Nanyang Polytechnic and it concluded with an amazing turn out, garnering raving responses and feedback from both the speakers and attendees. For more information, visit our iOS Dev Scout Group and iOS Conf SG Page: iOS Conf SG Website:¬†http://iosconf.sg iOS Conf SG 2016 Videos:¬†https://engineers.sg/conference/iosconfsg2016 iOS Conf SG Facebook Page:¬†https://www.facebook.com/iosconfsg/ iOS Dev Scout Facebook Group:¬†https://www.facebook.com/groups/iosdevscout/
events.location: Carousell @ Keppel Towers 2, 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #12-00, 088540, Singapore

events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - May 2017 Meetup
events.description:
Dear All, Singapore SQL PASS Chapter meet up for May is scheduled on May 24th ( Wednesday) at 7 PM as usual. Speaker and topic details provided below 

Agenda: May 24th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8:15 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Khilitchandra Prajapati 8:15 PM to 8:30 - Break 8:30 PM to 9:15 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Dharmendra Keshari Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Conf Room SINOMB 22CF-15 (24) AV 

Topic 1: Deep dive into Configuring SSIS Packages Abstract: Configuring SSIS Packages can be a tricky problem to encounter more often than not. This session on SSIS Packages will run thro various methods in configuring SSIS packages, their pros and cons and the scenarios at which they can be applied. The Session will also cover the end to end deployment cycle of a SSIS Package and discuss package and project deployment models. The session would explain the various best practices to be followed while configuring and deploying SSIS Packages. Speaker Profile: Khilitchandra V. Prajapati, an Enterprise Architect (Data Warehouse & Business Intelligence) at Marina Bay Sands, Singapore. He has implemented various BI solutions in last couple of years for industries like Oil & Gas, Banking, Telecom, Insurance, Casino & Gaming, Hospitality and IT. His prime focus is on Microsoft BI Stack (SQL Server, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS) with MOSS, C#.Net. He is a MSBI enthusiast and shares his knowledge, experience & expertise via his blog (www.bigator.com) 


Topic 2: TSQL Fun & Explore few real life development problem Synopsis: In this session we will discuss real life development problem, how aggregation, grouping, and distinct functionality can influence execution plans, why multi-statement table valued function can give very degraded performance, how TOP function helps not to put extra memory pressure... there are many more things to learn. Speaker Profile: Dharmendra Keshari, Microsoft Data Platform MVP, has strong and in-depth experience in Database Management and its internals. Currently, working as Senior Database Administrator in one of the best organization in Singapore. He is an avid, regular mentor on social media, helping several enthusiast in solving problems related to Database management. He has completed certification for ‚ÄúMicrosoft SQL Server¬Æ 2008, Implementation‚Äù and ‚ÄúMaintenance & Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Database‚Äù. You can follow his blog at www.dharmendrakeshari.com
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF15, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Monthly Meet - Defending against XML attacks in Python Web Application and ADHD
events.description: Agenda ‚Ä¢ High Tea and Networking ‚Ä¢ Introduction & Announcement ‚Ä¢ Defending against XML attacks in Python Web Application by Sanoop Thomas. ‚Ä¢ Case study of poor planning by Joshua Au. ‚Ä¢ A quick glance at ADHD by Michael McPhail. (each talk is of 45 mins. including Q&A) Abstract Defending against XML attacks in Django Case study of poor planning One common reason for project failures is poor planning (lack of foresight). The speaker will use the illustration of a case study on how poor planning may have unintended consequences for the stakeholders A quick glance at ADHD Active Defence Harbinger Distribution [ADHD - OpenSource]¬†contains preinstalled and configured¬†tools whose functions range from interfering with the attackers‚Äô reconnaissance to compromising the attackers‚Äô systems. Some of these are totally lame, some potentially illegal, some very cool and innovative. All provide an interesting foundation for discussion and skill building across the Active Defence spectrum.¬† Bio(s) of Speakers Sanoop is a moderator for Null Singapore chapter, and working as security consultant mainly involved with security assessment of web application, mobile, network, and servers. His area of interests lie in threat research, mobile security and automating pentest/analysis methodologies. He is also the author of Xtreme Vulnerable Web Application (XVWA) and Halcyon. He has spoken at OWASP India, Nullcon, and other conferences. Joshua is an admin manager and a security enthusiast. Michael is a¬†firm believer in well-roundedness and breadth of experience, Michael has¬†spent 20 years (mostly in Japan and other parts of Asia) in various security roles ranging from sysadmin, Unix gateway¬†antivirus¬†quality assurance engineer, strategic customer security liaison,¬†FW/IDS/VA¬†tech support, SIEM/GRC product manager, corporate intelligence operative,¬†ISP malware removal call center project manager, high net worth family office security advisor,¬†partner sales/sales engineering and¬†architect in managed security space for Symantec and FireEye. Presently, he is an independent consultant advising security startups on Asia market entry and helping local system integrator¬†partners to nurture security operations maturity among their clients. Current projects include: Red-Team Automation, Deception 2.0/Honeypots, Frugal Threat Hunting, Behaviour Analytics, and Incident Resilience Planning. ¬†
events.location: Zendesk Singapore, 401 Commonwealth Drive Haw Par Technocentre, #07-01
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: TechLadies Study CS50 - 24 May
events.description:
Join us in this women-only study group to learn computer science! While there will be one or two mentors to answer any technical questions you have, you need to be self-reliant as much as possible as this is not a workshop. 

In this study group, we are taking the course, HarvardX: CS50 Introduction to Computer Science, on edX together. As long as you are taking this course, please join us even if you're just getting started! üë©üèª‚Äçüíª üí™

To join in this study group, please:

1. Create an account on edX and enroll into the course at this link: https://courses.edx.org/courses/course-v1:HarvardX+CS50+X/info

2. Start from Week 0 or continue where you've left off. As the free wifi we are tapping on at the cafes might sometimes not be that great, do watch the lecture videos before you come. 

Feel free to join us if you're taking another programming course that's not the CS50 course. :) This Ruby on Rails tutorial is pretty good too: https://www.railstutorial.org/book

Bring your fully charged laptop and we'll see you soon!

Note: Please buy something at the cafe as we're merely crashing that cafe. We don't want to be kicked out! We're trying out different cafes in search for the most ideal place (spacious, good wifi, convenient location). Until the search is over, do be prepared to tether from your phone when we meet.

Psst! This study group is for women only. :)
events.location: The Daily Roundup, 1 Keong Saik Road #01-02, Singapore 089109

events.name: An exciting Re-frame / Reagent Presentation + Dojo is coming up!
events.description: After the April Meetup, there was much discussion on our Slack channel ‚Äì Re-frame¬†and Reagent¬†is a topic in which many of us are interested. So let's meet in May for a presentation + dojo on Re-frame! PS: Do keep sharing topics that you'd like to learn more of (and talk about!) on our Slack channel. Join by signing up at http://clojurians.net/ (http://clojurians.net/) and then searching for the #clojure-sg channel. Agenda: ‚Ä¢ 7:00 Food & Drinks ‚Ä¢ 7:25 Welcome / Introduction ‚Ä¢ 7:30 Introduction to Re-frame and Reagent ‚Ä¢ 8:00 Dojo + Q & A : Develop Survey - Single Page Application Please bring your own laptop with Clojure and editor installed ‚Ä¢ 9:00 Networking chat Speakers: Re-frame talk + dojo: Liu HaoQ & A Session: Robert Luo / Liu Hao Location: ThoughtWorks Singapore18 Cross Street#11-08 China Square CentralSingapore 048423 Thanks to ThoughtWorks for sponsoring the space and Flybot for the food/drinks. Please update your attendance if you can't make it, so folks on the wait list can fill your spot.
events.location: ThoughtWorks Singapore, 18 Cross Street, #11-08 China Square Central, Singapore 048423

events.name: Sangoma Roadshow - Singapore, May 24, 2017
events.description:
We're going to be in Singapore¬†giving you the opportunity to see and learn about the latest unified communications solutions from Sangoma. The event will showcase the advantages of partnering with us.
There is no cost to attend, but pre-registration is required. We hope you will join us May 24th at The Wine Glass, Marina at Keppel Bay, 2 Keppel Bay Vista in Singapore and get empowered by Sangoma.¬†
At this event, you'll...¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Learn how to leverage the Sangoma Partner Program to increase your bottom line¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Get up to speed on the latest developments in our unified communications solutions, including Sangoma Phones, FreePBX, PBXact UC, Gateways, Cards and SBC¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Connect with key members of the Sangoma team and grow your network¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Get introduced to Lantone, the Sangoma Distributor in Singapore¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Get an opportunity to network with the peers from your industry over complimentary dinner and drinks
Who should attend?
¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Enterprise users¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Systems integrators¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Resellers¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢ Value added resellersWhether you're new to Sangoma or are already a Partner, we look forward to seeing you at the roadshow.
Agenda ¬†(All times are in SGT)
6:30pm - 7:30pm - Registration & Refreshments7:30pm - 8:15pm - Welcome address & Introduction to Sangoma - Aveek Roy, Regional Director at Sangoma8:15pm - 9:00pm - Introduction to Lantone and FocalScope - Vikas Singhania, CEO at Lantone9:00pm - 10:00pm - Networking dinner and cocktail
events.location: The Wine Glass, Marina at Keppel Bay, Keppel Bay Pte Ltd, 2 Keppel Bay Vista 098382
